algorithm_technique: Two-pass approach: first pass from left to right, second pass from right to left, tracking the closest character.
problem_summary_simple: Find the distance from each character in a string to the nearest occurrence of a target character.
problem_summary_technical: Two passes over the string. Left-to-right pass finds distances to the nearest preceding target character. Right-to-left pass updates with the nearest succeeding character.
key_insights: The shortest distance to a character 'c' for any index 'i' is the minimum of the distance to the nearest 'c' on its left and the nearest 'c' on its right.
A single pass from left to right can find the distance to the nearest 'c' on the left.
A second pass from right to left can find the distance to the nearest 'c' on the right, and the minimum of the two passes gives the final answer.
